page.title: 07(2 FARMS CONTINUED)
page.content: EWES ARE CROSSED WITH BLUE-FACED LEICESTER RAMS TO PRODUCE MULE LAMBS ALL RAM LAMBS ARE SOLD FAT AND THE MULE EWE LAMBS ARE SOLD IN THE AUTUMN FOR BREEDING - THE AVERAGE PRICE BEING Â£50.FARMERS FROM ALL PARTS OF ENGLAND BUY THESE FOR CROSSING WITH SUFFOLK RAMS.THE BALANCE OF THE EWES ON EACH FARM ARE RETAINED AS PURE SWALEDALES IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE BREED AND PROVIDE REPLACEMENTS FOR THE FOLLOW- ING YEAR.THE SON AT THRINGILL HAS ESTABLISHED A EWE SCANNING BUSINESS. USING AN ULTRA SOUND SCANNER HE IS ABLE TO DETERMINE WHETHER OR NOT THEY ARE IN LAMBS AND THE NUMBER OF LAMBS BEING CARRIED.THIS NEW TECHNIQUE IMPROVES THE EFFICIENCY OF SHEEPFARM- ING,MAKING IT POSSIBLE TO CULL THE BARREN EWES EARLY AND FEED THE OTHERS ACCORDING TO THE NUMBER OF LAMBS EXP- ECTED.16500 WERE SCANNED IN EARLY 1985
